result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shavar Marquiz Jones not in court, in custody.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court for Shavar Marquiz Jones.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 11-9-22 at 8:30 am for final pretrial and 11-28-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Shavar Marquiz Jones not in court, in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Defense is missing some discovery and requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 9-30-22 at 8:30 am for status conference.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 10:
Defendant Shavar Marquiz Jones in court with Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Shavar Marquiz Jones in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Court took judicial notice of 11cf2878. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Hales Corners Officer N. Boneck. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court by video, defendant Shavar Marquiz Jones not in court, in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defense doesn't object to an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shavar Marquiz Jones in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shavar Marquiz Jones appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for State v Lee hearing.  Defense counsel has been recently appointed and requests preliminary hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 10
Defendant Shavar Marquiz Jones not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is GRANTED. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a STATE V-LEE Hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 10
Defendant Shavar Marquiz Jones not in court, defendant in custody.  Thomas Hasle in person appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shavar Marquiz Jones not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No Contact Order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $15,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RSB.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shavar Marquiz Jones in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Shavar Marquiz Jones in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shavar Marquiz Jones appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
